title: Mathematics Instructional Design Process Through Collaborative Decision-Making

context.additional_context: Simulation environment exploring math instructional design strategies across decision-making levels (institutional/program/course) via collaborative autoethnography.

learning_goals: Learners can logically deduce mathematics instructional design decisions within bounded rationality.
Learners can derive strategies applicable to instructional design problems at various levels through analogical reasoning.
Learners can experience real-world instructional design implementation processes in a simulation environment and incorporate immediate feedback.
difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
